definition: to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: Maybe you have missed the main chance .
sentences.chinese: 没准儿你放跑了一个大好机会。

sentences.english: Why not have a try? Maybe you will lose a good chance.
sentences.chinese: 为什么不试试？没准儿你放跑了一个大好机会。

sentences.english: They might even think that’s it out of control.
sentences.chinese: 你们也许还会想我的生活没准儿失控了。

sentences.english: This is it-this is probably permanent.
sentences.chinese: 就是这样，这没准儿是持久不变的了。

sentences.english: It may cure him of his bad habit.
sentences.chinese: 没准儿可以改掉他的坏习惯。

sentences.english: What may be bad for the waistline may be good for the wallet.
sentences.chinese: 对腰身不利的没准儿有利钱包。

sentences.english: Maybe I can solve this mystery.
sentences.chinese: 没准儿我能解开这个谜。

sentences.english: Maybe he's just a guy who hates going to the barber.
sentences.chinese: 没准儿他也就是个讨厌上理发店的家伙而已。

sentences.english: You never know. You could become the next watermelon seed-spitting world champion.
sentences.chinese: 谁知道呢，没准儿你就是下一届的吐西瓜籽世界冠军。

definition: more likely than not/quite possible/on the cards
certainly/also written 一準|一准[yi1 zhun3]
to have spare time/free from work/it's not important/it's nothing/never mind
